intro: Hypochaeris sellowii, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind. Hypochaeris sellowii is often found in temperate regions and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
